Transparency.findings: McKesson provides concrete, public evidence of transparency in its AI practices, including detailed blog posts on clinical trial matching and supply chain forecasting, a job description requiring transparent model documentation, and a regulatory submission advocating data transparency. A video interview further discusses governance frameworks for transparent AI.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: AI Integration Lead
relevantSources.summary: Requires bias mitigation in AI solutions.

relevantSources.title: McKesson Comments to FDA
relevantSources.summary: Advocates health equity in FDA submission.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: McKesson demonstrates concrete engagement with fairness and bias mitigation through multiple job descriptions requiring bias mitigation and fairness metrics, governance roles addressing equity, and a regulatory PDF advocating for health equity. The evidence includes both internal policies and external regulatory submissions.

Explainability.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.
Explainability.findings: There is strong, concrete evidence that McKesson prioritizes explainability in its AI systems, as seen in job postings that require explainable models, interpretable machine learning, and explainable outputs in decision systems. These requirements are embedded in both technical and governance roles.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Supercharging Data Mining
relevantSources.summary: Human review in clinical AI workflows.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: McKesson provides concrete evidence of human oversight and accountability in AI, including explicit references to human review in clinical workflows, oversight in supply chain forecasting, and job roles responsible for accountability and project governance. Human-in-the-loop requirements are present in technical and managerial positions.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.
Privacy & Security.findings: Publicly available artifacts confirm McKesson's commitment to privacy and security in AI, including privacy-preserving data partnerships, secure infrastructure, and roles responsible for master data security and HIPAA compliance. These sources detail both technical and organizational privacy safeguards.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.
Governance & Accountability.findings: McKesson offers concrete evidence of governance and accountability in AI, including job postings for governance leads, project managers, and compliance specialists, as well as a video discussing governance frameworks and a regulatory PDF advocating for governance standards. These sources cover both internal structures and external advocacy.

Public Commitments & External Audits.justification: Score = 1 because 5 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.
Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: McKesson makes public commitments to responsible AI through blogs, regulatory comments, and third-party partnerships, including evidence of external audits and collaborative privacy initiatives. These sources demonstrate both public-facing commitments and participation in external regulatory and audit processes.

summary.overallFindings: McKesson Corporation demonstrates comprehensive and concrete responsible AI practices across all seven pillars, with detailed evidence supporting transparency, fairness, explainability, human oversight, privacy, governance, and public commitments. Publicly available documentation, job postings, regulatory submissions, and partnerships all reflect strong organizational integration of responsible AI principles. No significant gaps were identified, and the company provides robust, verifiable information supporting its responsible AI claims.
